required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Tildrakizumab in Patients With Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis in Routine Clinical Practice
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study to Assess the Effectiveness, Safety Profile and Real-life Prescribing and Utilization Patterns of Tildrakizumab (Ilumetri®) in Patients With Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis in Routine Clinical Practice. (SAIL)

brief_summary.textblock: The observational, non-interventional study will assess the efficacy, safety, prescription and utilization patterns of Tildrakizumab in participants with moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in routine clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Absolute Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: PASI is a combined assessment of lesion severity and affected area into a single score.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Absolute Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: PASI is a combined assessment of lesion severity and affected area into a single score.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Change From Baseline in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: PASI is a combined assessment of lesion severity and affected area into a single score.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Change From Baseline in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: PASI is a combined assessment of lesion severity and affected area into a single score.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Correlation Between Absolute Psoriasis Area and Severity Index Scores and Dermatology Life Quality Index adjusted for not relevant responses (DLQI-R) at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: PASI is used to assess the lesion severity and affected area due to psoriasis. Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) questionnaire is the most commonly used tool to assess the effect of skin diseases on a subject's quality of life. Dermatology Life Quality Index adjusted for not relevant responses (DLQI-R) is a newly introduced variation of the regular DLQI that adjusts the total score for the number of not relevant responses.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Correlation Between Absolute Psoriasis Area and Severity Index Scores and Dermatology Life Quality Index adjusted for not relevant responses (DLQI-R) at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: PASI is used to assess the lesion severity and affected area due to psoriasis. Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) questionnaire is the most commonly used tool to assess the effect of skin diseases on a subject's quality of life. Dermatology Life Quality Index adjusted for not relevant responses (DLQI-R) is a newly introduced variation of the regular DLQI that adjusts the total score for the number of not relevant responses.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Percentage of Participants who maintaining Psoriasis Area and Severity Index 75, 90, and 100 Responses at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: PASI is a combined assessment of lesion severity and affected area into a single score.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Percentage of Participants who maintaining Psoriasis Area and Severity Index 75, 90, and 100 Responses at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: PASI is a combined assessment of lesion severity and affected area into a single score.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Absolute Body Surface Area Affected by Psoriasis (BSA) at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: BSA is a numerical score used to measure the total area of the body affected by psoriasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Absolute Body Surface Area Affected by Psoriasis (BSA) at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: BSA is a numerical score used to measure the total area of the body affected by psoriasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Change from Baseline in Body Surface Area Affected by Psoriasis at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: BSA is a numerical score used to measure the total area of the body affected by psoriasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Change from Baseline in Body Surface Area Affected by Psoriasis at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: BSA is a numerical score used to measure the total area of the body affected by psoriasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Absolute Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) (General, Nail, Scalp) Scores at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: PGA is a 5-point measure of psoriasis based on the degree of erythema, induration, and scale averaged over the entire body.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Absolute Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) (General, Nail, Scalp) Scores at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: PGA is a 5-point measure of psoriasis based on the degree of erythema, induration, and scale averaged over the entire body.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Change From Baseline in Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) (General, Nail, Scalp) at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: PGA is a 5-point measure of psoriasis based on the degree of erythema, induration, and scale averaged over the entire body. PGA of psoriasis in general, at nail and scalp will be graded from 0 (none/clear) to 4 (severe).

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Change From Baseline in Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) (General, Nail, Scalp) at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: PGA is a 5-point measure of psoriasis based on the degree of erythema, induration, and scale averaged over the entire body. PGA of psoriasis in general, at nail and scalp will be graded from 0 (none/clear) to 4 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Dermatology Life Quality Index and Dermatology Life Quality Index Adjusted for not Relevant Responses at Week 48 and Week 96 for Cohort 1 and Week 52 and Week 100 for Cohort 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cohort 1: Week 48 and Week 96; Cohort 2: Week 52 and Week 100
secondary_outcome.description: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) questionnaire is the most commonly used tool to assess the effect of skin diseases on a subject's quality of life. Dermatology Life Quality Index adjusted for not relevant responses (DLQI-R) is a newly introduced variation of the regular DLQI that adjusts the total score for the number of not relevant responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Absolute Dermatology Life Quality Index and Dermatology Life Quality Index Adjusted for not Relevant Responses at Week 48 and Week 96 for Cohort 1 and Week 52 and Week 100 for Cohort 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cohort 1: Baseline (Day 0), Week 48 and Week 96; Cohort 2: Baseline, Week 52 and Week 100
secondary_outcome.description: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) questionnaire is the most commonly used tool to assess the effect of skin diseases on a subject's quality of life. Dermatology Life Quality Index adjusted for not relevant responses (DLQI-R) is a newly introduced variation of the regular DLQI that adjusts the total score for the number of not relevant responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Itch and Pain Visual Analogue Scales (VAS) Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Itch and pain of the skin will be assessed by the participant on visual analogue scales (VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Itch and Pain Visual Analogue Scales Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Itch and pain of the skin will be assessed by the participant on visual analogue scales (VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who Used Concomitant Medications From Baseline at Week 48 and 96 for Cohort 1 and Week 52 and 100 for Cohort 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cohort 1: Baseline (Day 0), Week 48 and Week 96; Cohort 2: Baseline, Week 52 and Week 100
secondary_outcome.description: Concomitant topical, photo- or systemic anti-psoriatic and non-psoriasis therapy will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Body Weight at End of study (EOS)/End of treatment (ET)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the body weight measurement will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Waist and hip Circumference at EOS/ET
secondary_outcome.description: Change in waist and hip circumference will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Body Mass Index (BMI) at EOS/ET
secondary_outcome.description: Change in BMI will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Blood Pressure at EOS/ET
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Blood Pressure will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Food Intake up to EOS/ET
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to complete a simple questionnaire regarding their food intake.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Physical Activity up to EOS/ET
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to complete a simple questionnaire regarding their physical activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Lipid Profiles up to EOS
secondary_outcome.description: Serum lipid will be assessed, if available

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Withdraw From the Study Overtime
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who discontinue treatment prior to the regular end of the observation period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Underwent Dose Change up to EOS/ET
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who underwent dose change (100 mg or 200 mg).
Drug survival is defined as the time from initiation of therapy to discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participant's With Adherence to Treatment up to EOS/ET
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participant's who adhere to the treatment will be assessed.

arm_group.description: Participants will be treated with tildrakizumab who have participated in prior tildrakizumab studies
Participants will be newly prescribed tildrakizumab (a prescription has occurred independently of the enrolment in the study)

intervention.description: The study physicians will choose the treatment independently of the enrolment in the study according to routine care.

study_pop.textblock: Adult male and female patients with moderate-to-severe chronic plaque psoriasis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent form.
- Age >= 18years.
- Moderate to severe chronic plaque psoriasis diagnosis.
- Participants who have participated in Tildrakizumab (Ilumetri®) clinical trials (Cohort 1) OR participants who, according to the physician's therapeutic decision, should start the treatment with Tildrakizumab (Ilumetri®) (Cohort 2).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to comply with the requirements of the study or who in the opinion of the study physician should not participate in the study.
- Participants meeting any of the exclusion criteria specified in the summary of product characteristics (SmPC) of Ilumetri®.
